intro: Gamocarpha australis, commonly known as the Australian thistle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous fruits that are dispersed by wind. Gamocarpha australis is considered a weed in some regions due to its aggressive growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
